title: Extract Standards — extractStd
text: Separates specified serial dilutions fitting, background, samples

title: Extract Standards — extractStd
code: extractStd(MFI, stdstr, bgstr, stddil, smpdil, antigen, fname, pdate)

title: Extract Standards — extractStd
text: MFI data frame variable "Sample" contains information standard concentrations "1/dilution" format (e.g. "1/200"). stdstr character string indicating standards file's "Sample" column. case sensitive. "" (empty string), standards determined pattern "1/" . bgstr character string indicating background file's "Sample" column. case sensitive. stddil standard dilutions use standard curve fitting. NULL, dilutions indicated "Sample" variable used. smpdil single value sample dilutions (dilutions provided smp data frame). Ignored dilvar provided variable included smp data frame. antigen character string. fname name file contains raw data. pdate date plate processing.

title: Extract Standards — extractStd
text: list standards fitting, background values, sample values,   indices samples.

title: Extract Standards — extractStd
text: details

title: Fit Standards — fitStd
text: Fit specified function standards (serial dilutions). Optionally interactive procedure allows remove outliers, evaluate resulting fits, perform revisions, record message regarding fit.

title: Fit Standards — fitStd
code: fitStd(   std,   xvar,   yvar,   dilvar = "Dilution",   model = "sigmoid",   Alow = NULL,   asym = TRUE,   interactive = TRUE,   monot.prompt = FALSE,   rm.before = FALSE,   rm.after = interactive,   maxrm = 2,   set.bounds = FALSE,   overwrite.bounds = FALSE,   bg = NULL,   vsmp = NULL,   optmethod = "Nelder-Mead",   maxit = 5000,   info = "",   ifix = NULL,   stdcol = c("firebrick3", "darkslategray"),   rugcol = c("cadetblue", "purple", "firebrick2"),   ... )

title: Fit Standards — fitStd
text: std matrix data frame standards fitting. xvar, yvar character strings variables used fit standard curve. NULL, first two columns assumed x y variables. dilvar character string check dilution variable std. found, used x-axis labels . model model fit. Alow lower asymptote sigmoid model. NULL, lower asymptote estimated, adding extra parameter model. fix asymptote level background, specify "bg". Numeric value Alow force asymptote fixed provided level. asym TRUE, asymmetry fit allowed, adding extra parameter model. interactive logical value. TRUE, user prompted evaluate standards (/fit) asked remove outliers needed. TRUE value takes precedence rm.rm.: FALSE, rm.reset TRUE. monot.prompt TRUE, user prompted evaluate standards possibly remove outliers standards monotonic (increasing). FALSE value ignored interactive TRUE. rm.logical value indicating potential outliers removed model fitted. Ignored interactive FALSE. rm.logical value indicating potential outliers removed model fitted. Ignored interactive FALSE. maxrm maximum number outliers remove. set.bounds TRUE, user given option manually set bound set automatically. case, prompt appears even interactive FALSE. overwrite.bounds logical value indicating option overwrite automatically set bounds. Ignored interactive FALSE. bg values background spots. vsmp sample values. optmethod method used optimization. maxit maximum number iterations optimization. info information particular run warning messages. ifix sorted integer vector length 3 indices standards used getting starting values optimization. stdcol vector two colors standard points fit plot. rugcol vector three colors rugplot, indicates sample values (inside bounds, bounds extrema, beyond extrema). ... graphical parameters.

title: Fit Standards — fitStd
text: list containing parameters fit bounds fit (named   vectors), well indices removed points () flags r.

title: Fit Standards — fitStd
text: added

title: Normalize Samples — normalizeSmp
text: Calculate sample concentration based fit standard dilutions.

title: Normalize Samples — normalizeSmp
code: normalizeSmp(   smp,   smpvar,   resvar,   dilvar,   FUNinv,   par,   bounds,   fitflag,   fitlog,   trim.flat = TRUE,   extrapolate.low = FALSE,   extrapolate.up = FALSE )

title: Normalize Samples — normalizeSmp
text: smp data frame containing samples smpvar character string indicating sample variable. dilvar, resvar character strings dilution variable results. FUNinv inverse function infer sample concentration par values model function parameters bounds named vector values extrema bounds indicating "flat" regions curve fitflag flag fit returned fitStd fitlog character string indicating standard values log-transformed fitting. string contains _x_, xvar transformed, contains _y_ - yvar. trim.flat logical value determining values yvar trimmed. TRUE, trimmed bounds curve starts flatten (automatically determined maxima third derivative function). FALSE, yvar trimmed extrema, defined range standards asymptotes fit (whichever less extreme). extrapolate.low TRUE, sample values beyond lower bounds processed extrapolation standard curve (recommended). Takes precedence trim.flat value. extrapolate.TRUE, sample values beyond upper bounds processed extrapolation standard curve (recommended). Takes precedence trim.flat value.

title: Normalize Samples — normalizeSmp
text: data frame.

title: Normalize Samples — normalizeSmp
text: coming

what: Plot the fit for standards and the samples — plotFit
title: Plot the fit for standards and the samples — plotFit
text: Produces plot includes points standards, proposed fit, removed outliers, bounds "flat" portions curve, values samples background.

title: Plot the fit for standards and the samples — plotFit
code: plotFit(   std,   xvar,   yvar,   dilvar,   fitpar = NULL,   FUNmod = NULL,   iout = NULL,   bg = NULL,   vsmp = NULL,   smpflag = NULL,   trimval = NULL,   trimext = NULL,   stdcol = c("firebrick3", "darkslategray"),   rugcol = c("cadetblue", "purple", "firebrick2"),   ... )

title: Plot the fit for standards and the samples — plotFit
text: std matrix data frame standards fitting. xvar, yvar character strings variables used fit standard curve. NULL, first two columns assumed x y variables. dilvar character string check dilution variable std. found, used x-axis labels . fitpar values function parameters. FUNmod model function. iout indices removed standard points. bg background values. vsmp sample values. smpflag character vector, flags sample. trimval final results, values samples trimmed. trimext integer vector length two indicating values trimmed extremum (lower upper). stdcol vector two colors standard points fit plot. rugcol vector three colors rugplot, indicates sample values (inside bounds, bounds extrema, beyond extrema). ... graphical parameters.

title: Plot the fit for standards and the samples — plotFit

what: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
title: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
text: Read raw luminex files, extract standards background (provided), format samples processing.

title: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
code: prepLum(   antigen,   fname,   fdir = NULL,   dtype = "Median",   stdstr = "std|stand",   bgstr = "blank|background",   stddil = NULL,   smpdil = 1000,   nwells = NULL,   nsep = 2,   ncolmax = 105,   dformat = "%m/%d/%Y" )

title: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
text: antigen character string. fname name file contains raw data. fdir directory file located (alternatively, full path can included fname). dtype character string data type file. stdstr character string indicating standards file's "Sample" column. case sensitive. "" (empty string), standards determined pattern "1/" . bgstr character string indicating background file's "Sample" column. case sensitive. stddil vector standard dilutions. NULL, dilutions inferred file's "Sample" column. Non-null value can used exclude dilutions model fitting. smpdil single value sample dilutions (dilutions provided smp data frame). Ignored dilvar provided variable included smp data frame. nwells number wells. NULL, inferred file. nsep number lines separating different data types file. ncolmax maximum number columns file. dformat date format file.

title: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
text: list standards fitting, background values, sample values,   indices samples.

title: Reformat raw luminex files for processing — prepLum
text: added

title: Process raw Luminex files — processSmp
text: Process data single antigen: fit standard curve, establish bounds, normalize samples, save plot showing fit samples.

title: Process raw Luminex files — processSmp
code: processSmp(   smp,   std,   bg = NULL,   smpdil = 1,   fitlog = "xy",   ismp = 1:nrow(smp),   plotdir = "./",   pname = NULL,   ptitle = "fit and samples",   xvar = NULL,   yvar = NULL,   smpvar = NULL,   addvar = NULL,   dilvar = NULL,   resvar = "concentration",   model = "sigmoid",   Alow = NULL,   asym = TRUE,   trim.flat = TRUE,   interactive = TRUE,   monot.prompt = FALSE,   rm.before = FALSE,   rm.after = interactive,   maxrm = 2,   set.bounds = interactive,   overwrite.bounds = FALSE,   ifix = NULL,   extrapolate.low = FALSE,   extrapolate.up = FALSE,   optmethod = "Nelder-Mead",   maxit = 5000,   stdcol = c("firebrick3", "darkslategray"),   rugcol = c("cadetblue", "purple", "firebrick2"),   width = 7,   height = 6,   ... )

title: Process raw Luminex files — processSmp
text: smp data frame sample ID, sample values optional variables (e.g. dilution). std matrix data frame standards fitting. bg values background spots. smpdil single value sample dilutions (dilutions provided smp data frame). Ignored dilvar provided variable included smp data frame. fitlog character string indicating standard values log-transformed fitting. string contains _x_, xvar transformed, contains _y_ - yvar. ismp indices samples plotted (e.g. exclude standards included smp data frame). plotdir directory plots saved. pname character string fit plot. NULL, based ptitle underscore substituted space. ptitle character string plot title. xvar, yvar character strings variables used fit standard curve. NULL, first two columns assumed x y variables. smpvar character string indicating sample variable. addvar named vector additional variables (e.g. date plate), element names used variable names smp. dilvar, resvar character strings dilution variable results. model model fit. Alow lower asymptote sigmoid model. NULL, lower asymptote estimated, adding extra parameter model. fix asymptote level background, specify "bg". Numeric value Alow force asymptote fixed provided level. asym TRUE, asymmetry fit allowed, adding extra parameter model. trim.flat logical value determining values yvar trimmed. TRUE, trimmed bounds curve starts flatten (automatically determined maxima third derivative function). FALSE, yvar trimmed extrema, defined range standards asymptotes fit (whichever less extreme). interactive logical value. TRUE, user prompted evaluate standards (/fit) asked remove outliers needed. TRUE value takes precedence rm.rm.: FALSE, rm.reset TRUE. monot.prompt TRUE, user prompted evaluate standards possibly remove outliers standards monotonic (increasing). FALSE value ignored interactive TRUE. rm.logical value indicating potential outliers removed model fitted. Ignored interactive FALSE. rm.logical value indicating potential outliers removed model fitted. Ignored interactive FALSE. maxrm maximum number outliers remove. set.bounds TRUE, user given option manually set bound set automatically. case, prompt appears even interactive FALSE. overwrite.bounds logical value indicating option overwrite automatically set bounds. Ignored interactive FALSE. ifix sorted integer vector length 3 indices standards used getting starting values optimization. extrapolate.low TRUE, sample values beyond lower bounds processed extrapolation standard curve (recommended). Takes precedence trim.flat value. extrapolate.TRUE, sample values beyond upper bounds processed extrapolation standard curve (recommended). Takes precedence trim.flat value. optmethod method used optimization. maxit maximum number iterations optimization. stdcol vector two colors standard points fit plot. rugcol vector three colors rugplot, indicates sample values (inside bounds, bounds extrema, beyond extrema). width, height optional parameters final saved plot. ... graphical parameters.

title: Process raw Luminex files — processSmp
text: list length three. first element data frame   contains results; second character string flag   containing information removed points, failure fit model,   manually set bounds, /optional custom note provided user   interactive model-fitting procedure. last element   number sample values results trimmed.

title: Process raw Luminex files — processSmp
text: Note fitlog contains _x_ thus xvar   standards log-transform fitting, results still returned   regular scale (values inverse function exponentiated   multiplied dilution).
